is subfamily of Motion Frames

Frames in this family:

Number of s: 28

FrameDescriptionFN FrameLUs
Affected motionVery broad notion of "Caused Motion" which applies both to internal and external causal sources/forces, and in which the 'cause' can affect the motion in any one of various ways, including enabling, initiating,helping, impeding, or preventing a (potential) mover's motion.

throng.n
hail.v
mob.v
MotionThis is the most general Motion frame. Frame description: All or part of an entity (mover) moves with respect to some landmark or background. This general frame encompasses both "motion-in-place" (movement that can occur within a fixed location, e.g. spinning) and translational motion (in which the mover occupies a series of different locations over time -- see Motion_Along_A_Path). This frame could also be used to specify lack of motion (i.e. speed = 0).move.v
motion.n
shift.v
shift.n
movement.n
mobility.n
mobile.a
immovable.a
Motion along a pathA moving entity starts out in one place and ends up in another, having traversed the distance between these placesMotion, Motion_directional, Motion_scenarioslide.v
